RECORDS.subject: ERROR - Server %(displayname)s Disconnected
RECORDS.event_description:
Status: ERROR
Server: ${displayname}
Details: ${info}${error}

We have lost the ability to communicate with the ${displayname} server. Possible causes include:

1. Network failure due to firewall or general connecitivity change
2. Server hardware failure
3. Server operating system failure
4. Palette Agent failure
RECORDS.email_message:
Status: ERROR
Server: ${displayname}
Details: ${info}${error}

We have lost the ability to communicate with the ${displayname} server. Possible causes include:

1. Network failure due to firewall or general connecitivity change
2. Server hardware failure
3. Server operating system failure
4. Palette Agent failure

ERROR - Tableau Server Partial Process Failure
INFO - Tableau Server Started by %(username)s
INFO - Tableau Server Recovered After Partial Process Failure
RECORDS.event_description:
Status: INFO

Your Tableau Server has recovered from a Partial Process Degrade Event (also called a Tableau Server Status Degrade). If this recovery happens automatically within 5 minutes of the initial Partial Process Degrade Event, then no further action is needed at this time. This is how the Tableau Server was designed to automatically manage its Processes.
RECORDS.email_message:
Status: INFO
Your Tableau Server has recovered from a Partial Process Degrade Event (also called a Tableau Server Status Degrade). If this recovery happens automatically within 5 minutes of the initial Partial Process Degrade Event, then no further action is needed at this time. This is how the Tableau Server was designed to automatically manage its Processes.

RECORDS.subject: WARNING - Tableau Server Stopped by %(username)s
INFO - Tableau Server OK Again After Unexpected Stop
RECORDS.event_description:
Status: INFO

Your Tableau Server has returned to normal operation after an unexpected stop. This can sometimes happen if another user has manually stopped and started the Tableau Server directly from the Tableau Server application. It is recommended that you always use your Palette Server to stop and start your Tableau Server to reduce unnecessary false alerts.
RECORDS.email_message:
Status: INFO

Your Tableau Server has returned to normal operation after an unexpected stop. This can sometimes happen if another user has manually stopped and started the Tableau Server directly from the Tableau Server application. It is recommended that you always use your Palette Server to stop and start your Tableau Server to reduce unnecessary false alerts.

RECORDS.subject: ERROR - Tableau Server Stopped Unexpectedly
RECORDS.event_description:
Status: ERROR
Details: Your Tableau Server has been unexpectedly Stopped. Please investigate the cause.
RECORDS.email_message:
Status: ERROR
Details: Your Tableau Server has been unexpectedly Stopped. Please investigate the cause.
